Key Arguments: The bill is seen as an extreme form of censorship.
Free speech and debate should be encouraged in a democratic society.
The government should focus on defining healthy debate rather than policing speech.
Platform operators should use disclaimers instead of verifying information.
The government has failed to regulate harmful content like pornography and scams, which have real negative impacts.
The bill would criminalize ordinary citizens while ignoring actual criminal elements.
The bill is viewed as undemocratic and un-Australian.
Main Themes: Focus on real harm versus perceived harm
Notable Quotes: The proposed bill is an attempt at an extreme form of censorship.
This is undemocratic and un-Australian to the core.
We therefore say to you most emphatically take your hands off our freedoms.
This is not China or Russia or North Korea.
